title: Project-Based Learning for Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Using Manipulative (FLAP) Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational arithmetic operations and understanding of simple problem-solving procedures
context.additional_context: Development and application of character flip teaching materials usable on digital devices, with problem design centered on social studies case studies

learning_goals: Learners can explain step-by-step problem-solving strategies for complex math problems with 80% accuracy using flap manipulatives
Learners creatively design math problems reflecting real-world social cases through PBL team activities at least three times
Learners improve logical thinking and decision-making abilities during problem-solving processes by over 70% in formative assessments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
